captions.text: We were born to endure what the body holds up
we endured what came and we will endure what will come
we endure [things] even when our seconds are numbered
our bodies can endure being choked up to fifteen minutes.
We endure lashes, our arms being cut off,
fractures in any bone, three weeks with a cast.
We always hold the urge to go to the bathroom
to see Halley's comet you have to hold for 70 years.
We endure with school, the faculty, the institution
at dinnertime, we hold in our burps.
The townspeople of Burundi continues to endure famine
we hold out three3 days to arrive at the moon.
We endure the cold of the Arctic, the heat of the tropics
we endure microscopic viruses with our antibodies
we endure storms, hurricanes, bad weather
we endured Nagasaki, we endured Hiroshima.
Despite not wanting to, we endure new laws
We endure in this day and time that kings still exist
we punish the humble and tolerate the cruel
we endure being slaves because of the color of our skin.
We endure capitalism, communism, socialism,
feudalism, even stupidism.
We bear with the guilty when they pretend to be innocent
we endure our f… president every year.
For what was and for what could have been
for what is, for what may be missing
for what’s to come and for this instant
let's toast endurance!
For what was and for what could have been
for what is, for what may be missing
for what’s to come and for this instant
raise your glass and let’s toast endurance!
Let’s toast endurance!
We endure all types of pain even if it hurts us
we endured Pinochet, we endured Videla
Franco, Mao, Ríos Montt, Mugabe, Hitler, Idi Amin
Stalin, Bush, Truman, Ariel Sharón and Hussein.
We endured over twenty concentration camps
when you swim underwater you hold your breath
to build a wall you need to hold the bricks
the non-smoker endures the smell of cigarettes
we endure Monsanto infecting our food
we endure Agent Orange and pesticides
when we navigate, we endure seasickness
we endure minimum wage and unemployment.
We endured the Falklands and the British invasion
and in the city of Pompeii we endured volcanic lava
and within the logic of our humanity
we believe lies and no one withstands the truth.
For what was and for what could have been
for what is, for what may be missing
for what’s to come and for this instant
raise your glass and let’s toast endurance!
Let’s toast endurance!
We tolerate the atheist, the Mormon, the Christian
the Buddhist, the Jew, the pagan
we tolerate the one who sells bullets and the one who fires them
we endured Lennon’s death and Victor Jara’s.
We endured many wars: Vietnam, the Cold War
the Hundred Years War, The Six-Day War.
Let them endure revenge, we are coming to retaliate
today our liver endures whatever the bar invites.
For what was
for what is
for what will be
Sláinte!
For what was and for what could have been
for what is, for what may be missing
for what’s to come and for this instant
let's toast endurance!
For what was and for what could have been
for what is, for what may be missing
for what’s to come and for this instant
raise your glass and let’s toast endurance!
Let’s toast endurance!
